sanitised_text:
Bob, is married to Sue. Sue cooked him dinner and was up till midnight waiting for Bob to come home. His cell was turned off and her increasingly desperate messages went right to voicemail and her texts were never answered.
Bob missed dinner because he went out for drinks with some male colleagues after work and they ended up at a strip club, They all got very drunk and had lap dances.
He came home very drunk with his clothing disheveled and in no condition to answer any of Sue’s questions coherently.
The next morning, Sue asks Bob to explain why he missed dinner and didn’t answer her texts. Bob becomes extremely defensive and tries to side step her questions.
Bob: Please leave me alone. My head hurts.
Sue: Well, you shouldn’t have been drinking! I was waiting at home for you. I made dinner. I deserve an explanation. What were you doing that was so important that you couldn’t let me know?
Bob: Look, let’s talk about it some other time.
Sue: You owe me an explanation. I need some clarity about why you came home drunk with your shirt half open.
Bob: I work hard all day. Aren’t I entitled to relax and have a drink after work?
Sue: But what about me? You knew I was home waiting for you. How could you be so thoughtless and cruel?
Bob: Shut up b*tch!

expressions.text: Please leave me alone. My head hurts.
Well, you shouldn’t have been drinking! I was waiting at home for you. I made dinner. I deserve an explanation. What were you doing that was so important that you couldn’t let me know?
Look, let’s talk about it some other time.
You owe me an explanation. I need some clarity about why you came home drunk with your shirt half open.
I work hard all day. Aren’t I entitled to relax and have a drink after work?
But what about me? You knew I was home waiting for you. How could you be so thoughtless and cruel?

unused_labels: Acting as if nothing remarkable happened
Answering a different question than was asked
Choosing a most comfortable environment for themselves to feel more powerful
Convincing to give up something important
Creating a constraint favorable to the speaker
Giving too brief or incomplete answers
Making another person dependent on speaker for information
Making other feel like they are doing something wrong
Making others more dependent on them
Making others more dependent on them for information
Making others question their own reality
Making promises about great future while neglecting present situation
Not asking for the other person's viewpoint on relevant matters
Not verifying the negative assumptions about the other person
Subverting the goals of the other person
qualitative_evaluation: Bob's conversational style is defensive and evasive. He avoids answering Sue's questions directly and tries to deflect the conversation. He also becomes aggressive and disrespectful towards the end. Sue, on the other hand, is assertive and persistent. She demands answers and clarity from Bob, expressing her feelings of being neglected and disrespected. She maintains a tone of confrontation throughout the conversation.
